required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Third Epidemiological Research of Refractory Wounds in China
clinical_study.official_title: The Third Epidemiological Research of Refractory Wounds in China

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: Second Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a cross-sectional survey in patients who underwent treatment of chronic cutaneous wounds from a nationally representative sample in our hospital from January 2018 to December 2018．

detailed_description.textblock: Chronic cutaneous wounds represent a major health care burden in China However, limited information exists regarding the epidemiologic changes associated with recent social and economic devdopment．We designed a cross-sectional survey in patients who underwent treatment of chronic cutaneous wounds from a nationally representative sample in our hospital from January 2018 to December 2018．

primary_outcome.measure: the prevalence of chronic cutaneous wounds among hospitalized patients
primary_outcome.description: All the patients with refractory wounds on the body surface

secondary_outcome.description: patients had results of bacterial cultivation
Treatment was paid by the patients, social medical insurance, commercial medical insurance, or free medical care．

intervention.description: Collect the data of this year and compare it with that of ten years ago

study_pop.textblock: Chinese Patients who underwent treatment of chronic cutaneous wounds in our hospital from 1/2018-12/2018

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who underwent treatment of chronic cutaneous wounds in our hospital from 1/2018-12/2018．
Exclusion Criteria:
- No

overall_official.affiliation: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University

facility.name: 2nd Affiliated Hospital, School of Medicine, Zhejiang University
